message: I propose Tom Igoe's "Making Things Talk," Dan O'Sillivan's "Physical Computing," L.M. Milne-Thompson's "Theoretical Aerodynamics," & Rob Faludi's book on Wireless Networks.
Also P.W. Singer's "Wired for War," about military robotics, & a book about designing better human-machine interfaces, called "Press On." The author's name escapes me.
